decks.notes: This Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a variety of creatures and removal spells. The deck features powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls, supported by spells like Galvanic Discharge and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides an additional source of mana and flexibility. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive strategy, with a mix of lands and fetch spells to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on quick creature drops like Amped Raptor and Ocelot Pride, supported by cards like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and The One Ring help to control the board and protect your creatures, while the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds an extra layer of versatility to your strategy. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of creature aggression and burn spells.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by consistently countering their spells and removing their threats using cards like Force of Negation and Fatal Push. This is combined with card advantage from cards like Thought Scour and Dreams of Steel and Oil to maintain control of the game. The deck also utilizes powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently neutralized. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while minimizing the risk of being disrupted by opposing land destruction effects.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to utilize The One Ring artifact to generate additional mana and play powerful spells such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Wrath of the Skies. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler to provide additional card advantage and disruption. The goal is to out-value the opponent and establish a dominant board presence while keeping their threats in check.

The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and surveilling to control the top of their deck. Utilizing a combination of counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, removal spells like Fatal Push, and card draw like Consider and Thought Scour, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can win with its powerful finishers like Psychic Frog and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck also uses the graveyard as a resource with cards like Unearth and Graveyard Trespasser.

This deck focuses on using Leylines and other enchantments to control the board while setting up the combo involving Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By ramping with cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to cast Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal massive damage with Valakut triggers. The deck also has removal options like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with Valakut triggers.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Ulamog, the Defiler for explosive plays. It also includes cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The deck runs a mix of lands to support the different colors required for the spells, along with creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide additional utility. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they can react.
